content:
B. Circumcision controversy 
C. Idol worship 
D. Demon possession. 
50. According to Paul, which of the following is the 
greatest?  
A. Truth B.  Love C.  Faith D. Hope 
 
49. “... I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees; with respect to 
the hope and resurrection of the dead I am on trial.” 
This was part of the address of Paul to 
A. the Jerusalem crowd 
B. King Agrippa and Festus 
C. the Sanhedrin 
D. the tribune. 
 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1993  
 
 
1. According to the creation account of Genesis 1, 
God charged man to 
A. rest on the Sabbath day 
B. worship Him 
C. have dominion over all the earth 
D. obey all His commandments. 
 
2. “Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man shall his 
blood be shed; for God made man in his own image.” 
This statement explains the 
 
A. existence of blood revenge 
B. significance of blood 
C. disapproval of violence 
D. prohibition of blood revenge. 
 
3. When God told Abraham that Sarah would have a child, 
Abraham laughed because 
A. Hagar prompted him 
B. his wife Sarah laughed 
C. they were too old to have a child 
D. he already had a child called Ishmael. 
 
4. After Jacob’s dream at Bethel, he promised that he would 
A. continue to live there forever 
B. give a tenth of all he would have to God 
C. return immediately and settle there with his 
family 
D. go to his father’s house in peace. 
 
5. Why did Judah advise his brother against shedding the 
blood of Joseph? 
A. He was afraid of blood 
B. Joseph was their brother 
C. Blood is life 
D. He wanted to raise some money by selling Joseph. 
 
6. Why did God redeem the Israelites from the hands of 
Pharaoh? 
A. God remembered His covenant with Abraham, 
Isaac and Jacob. 
B. They yoke of the Israelites was heavy 
C. God wanted to show His power to Pharaoh 
D. He wanted to show that Moses was powerful 
 
7. When the people of Israel saw the great work of the 
LORD in drowning the Egyptians, they 
A. built an altar to the LORD 
B. became afraid of Moses rod. 
C. believed in Moses 
D. made a golden calf. 
 
8. The golden calf which Aaron made for the people of 
Israel signified 
A. a return to the gods of Egypt. 
B. the final break with the god that brought 
them out of Egypt. 
C. the beginning of idolatry in Israel 
D. the end of Moses’ leadership of the people 
of Israel. 
9. During the giving of the law at Mount Sinai, the 
Israelites wanted Moses to speak to them instead of 
God because 
A. the people were afraid and trembled 
B. they thought they would die 
C. they did not consecrate themselves 
D. Moses was their spokesman. 
 
10. Where did Joshua gather all the tribes of Israel for 
presentation before God? 
A. Shechem B. Dan C.  Sinai D. Shiloh 
 
11. The valley of Eshcol is symbolic to Israel because it 
was the place where 
A. Moses and his people had a resounding 
victory over the Amalekites 
B. the men of Israel cut down the cluster of 
grapes 
C. the spies set out to survey Canaan 
D. the Israelites challenged the leadership of 
Moses and Aaron. 
 
12. The report brought by the men who followed Caleb to 
spy the land of Canaan showed that the land 
A. was desolate 
B. had rich fruits 
C. devoured its inhabitants 
D. flowed with milk and honey  
 
13. The Shema emphasizes the 
A. unity of God 
B. had rich fruits 
C. omnipotence of God 
D. importance of Israel to the world, 
 
14. “The LORD give you children by this woman for the 
loan which she lent to the LORD;…” 
A. Samuel B.  Isaac C.  Samson D.   Ishmael
